OrgName: St. Jude Medical, Inc. and its US divisions including St. Jude Medical, Cardiology Division, Inc.
activities:
Personal Information Received from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland:
St. Jude Medical, Inc. (including its United States subsidiaries) receives human resources information regarding its European employees for use in the following ways: • Processing employee pay-rolls and expense reimbursement • Administering benefits • Keeping records of training program attendance or completion • Succession planning and talent management • Regulatory compliance (including operation of a hotline and maintaining files of signed acknowledgements relating to certain St. Jude Medical policies or codes of conduct) • Litigation and protecting the company against injury, theft, legal liability, fraud, abuse or other misconduct • Regulatory investigations • Internal investigations and disciplinary matters • Performance evaluation and management • Administering benefits (e.g., stock options and bonus programs) • Implementing and maintaining internal networks and IT systems • Maintaining databases of employees for global directories • Corporate transactions (e.g., merger or acquisition) involving SJM • Company building security and programs to enhance the personal safety and security of employees • Travel program • Financial planning
corpofftitle1: VP, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
